thread.title: Lexi Potter's goal lifts South Glens Falls to girls' soccer win
thread.title_full: Lexi Potter's goal lifts South Glens Falls to girls' soccer win - Times Union

author: Staff reports
title: Lexi Potter's goal lifts South Glens Falls to girls' soccer win
text:
Lexi Potter scored with 11 minutes left in the game to give South Glens Falls a 1-0 win over Mohonasen on Saturday in a nonleague girls' soccer game in South Glens Falls.
Gabrielle Kreppein set up the winner when she played a ball over the top of the Mighty Warriors' defense and hit Potter, who scored on a breakaway. Elyse Green made eight saves for South High (8-3).
More girls' soccer: Maddie Phelan scored with 20 minutes remaining to give Schoharie a 1-0 win over Lake George in a nonleague game. Lake George goaltender Rachel Shambo came out of the net to try to stop Phelan's shot, but Phelan was able to sneak a shot into the left side of the net to give Schoharie (10-1) the lead. ... Genevieve Palmer and Chelsea Ruggiero had two goals apiece to lead Greenville to a 5-1 victory over visiting Cairo-Durham in a Patroon Conference matchup.
Boys' soccer: Brandon Mimas scored on a deflected pass in Niskayuna's backfield to give Baldwinsville of Section III a 1-0 win at Niskayuna. Antonio Mullen made three saves for the Bees, while Joey Romano made five in net for the Silver Warriors. ... Silas Yelich had three goals to help Greenville get past Cairo-Durham, 4-1, in a Patroon Conference game at Greenville. Samuel Statham had the other goal and also chipped in with three assists for the Spartans, who climbed to 7-2 and 6-1 in league play with the win. ... Shane Wenz also had a hat trick to lead Ichabod Crane to a 3-1 victory against Albany Academy in a Colonial Council contest. The Riders sit atop the league's Patriot Division with a 10-1 mark while Albany Academy is in second-place in the Colonial Council's Liberty Division with an 8-3 record.
